text.p: - Despite his health problems, President Boris Yeltsin is in control of the situation in the country, Kremlin chief of staff Anatoly Chubais says in an interview with the newspaper. The president will hand over his responsibilities to Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin just before the heart surgery for a period of "10 hours or may be a day or two", says Chubais.
- Local deputies of the Nenetsky autonomous region in Russia's north have decided to hand over to a local oil company two oil deposits from the Timan-Pechora Company international project.

- Having spent only a day in Chechnya, Russian Security Council chief Alexander Lebed managed to solve all the problems raised by the suspension of Russian troops withdrawal from the breakaway republic, the paper says.
- The apparent stability of the Russian currency contradicts the general financial situation in the country, one of the newspaper's experts says.

- The official Russian position is to differentiate between Islamic fundamentalism and Islamic extremism, paying due respect to the former and withstanding the latter, says Russian Foreign minister Yevgeny Primakov in an article published by the paper.
- The basic principle of a solution of the Chechen crisis is the territorial integrity of Russia, says Communist Party leader Gennady Zyuganov.

- "We are holding new positions in Chechnya and are not going to leave because it is not clear what political decision will be taken (about the republic), says General Anatoly Shkirkocommander of Russia's interior ministry troops in Chechnya.
- Agreements signed recently by Russian Security supremo Alexander Lebed and the Chechen separatist commander Aslan Maskhadov do not provide for the protection of the Russian population of Chechnya.
- Russia can counterbalance the revival of Islamic laws in Chechnya only by restoring a genuinely working law-enforcement system.
